meanings.definition: A figure of speech in which the syntactic relation between words is reversed.
meanings.sent1: In the poem, the hypallages made the reader think differently about the words' order.
meanings.sent2: The hypallages in the sentence confused the students because of the reversed word order.
meanings.sent3: The hypallages in the story played a trick on the characters by switching their roles.
meanings.sent4: Her use of hypallages in the speech turned the ordinary into something extraordinary.
meanings.sent5: The hypallages created a puzzle for the audience to solve.

meanings.definition: The use of a word in a grammatical relation to another word rather than to the meaning of the word itself.
meanings.sent1: The hypallages in the sentence showed how words can have different roles.
meanings.sent2: By using hypallages, the writer emphasized the structure of the sentence.
meanings.sent3: The hypallages in the conversation made the listener focus on the word connections.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style with hypallages added layers of meaning to the text.
meanings.sent5: The hypallages highlighted the importance of word order in the sentence.
